result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript of September 23, 2016, Plea & Sentencing Hearing
Criminal Case Settlement

cases #15CM411, #16CM175, #16CM183, #16CM281, #16CF136, #16CF243, #16CF336 called at 3:36pm. 
Defendant Bradley J. Jacobson in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance as to all files.   

As part of the parties Criminal Case Settlement Agreement, the Court strikes the "on or near school" enhancer in Case #16CM183-Count #1. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered in Case #16CF136--Counts #1 and #2, and in Case #15CM411-Count #1, and in Case #16CM183-Count #1, and in Case #16CF243-Counts #1 and #2 and #3 and #4, and in Case #16CF336-Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Jacobson guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.
Repeater finding made.

On Motion of the State and joint-recommendation of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining Counts in Cases #15CM411,  #16CM183, and #16CF366;  and the Court reads in and dismisses Cases #16CM175 and #16CM281.  Further, the Court reads-in an uncharged referral for Misdemeanor Theft on 5/20/16 in the City of Watertown (DA Case #16JE1565, Watertown PD Case #2016-1253) and the Court bars further prosecution of that referral--jeopardy attaches.  

In Case #16CF136-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Jacobson to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
In Case #16CF243-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Jacobson to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with #16CF136-Count #1.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  99 days credit for time already served on each of these cases.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--in Case #16CF136 only:  to pay restitution of $237.74 to Daniel J. Schmidt
--to comply with DNA sample provision;  this same is to be taken at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department, rather than this awaiting it being accomplished in the prison system
--to pay costs, fees, assessments
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #16CF136-Count #2, and in Case #15CM411-Count #1, and in Case #16CM183-Count #1, and in Case #16CF243-Counts #2 & #3 & #4, and in Case #16CF336-Counts #2 & #3, the Court imposes the payment of costs, fees, assessments; these amounts are to be entered as a civil judgment.  
In Case #16CF336 only, the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution of $129.44 in favor of Watertown Pick N' Save.
Days Credit for time already served:  99 days


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 4:39pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf]
Defendant Bradley J. Jacobson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Hagemann advises that the defendant continues to qualify for SPD representation.
Attorney Hagemann informs the Court that the defendant had the flu and was not able to make the status, he did call her and the Court.
Attorney Flint has no objection to the signature bond being reinstated since it was only 2 days since the missed court date.
No objection from Attorney Hagemann.
Court reinstates the signature bond with same non- monetary conditions to continue.

Attorney Hagemann requests that this case be scheduled for a status on the same date and time as the defendant's 2 new cases, whcih is May 24, 2016 at 2:00 pm
Court schedules this case for status as requested by Attorney Hagemann.

Recess: 1:20 pm
